intro_text: Explore the lived experience of working in data.
pbn: to enter the world of data

intro_text: Welcome employee #eiLaSi-LV-426-ekaCehT to your first day at TechCo! You are a data scientist. It is your job to press buttons.
Welcome employee  #eiLaSi-LV-426-ekaCehT to onboarding at TechCo! You are a data scientist. It is your job to press buttons.
An executive at TechCo has a question that needs answering. You are told the data can be found in the data warehouse, no problem. Once you are done with the anlaysis, there will be cake.
pbn: to consult stakeholders about their evidence-based needs

intro_text: The data warehouse is home to hundreds of databases. Each database is home to dozens of tables, each of which has hundreds of columns. There are billions of rows of data.
pbn: to dive into the warehouse and live in matrix-scroll land of scrutinising seemingly endless columns and rows

intro_text: Now that you have figured out which data sources you need to extract from, you are ready to transform the data into analytic tables that will form the foundation of your shiny analyses. You are sure looking forward to that cake.

Finally, the fun part! Making pretty pictures out of data to answering questions in meaningful ways. Spurred on by the promise of cake, you lose yourself in the finesse of choosing colour palettes and developing visualisations that answer the multi-faceted question that was posed. You work late into the night.
The big day has arrived! The boardroom is filled with middle-managers somewhat awfully assembled around croissants and tepid coffee. No cake yet, but getting ever closer.
You receive a calendar invite from your manager saying they have met with leadership and want to discuss how the analysis was received. There is no mention of cake.
pbn: to meet with your manager about the outcome of the analysis and whether you will get cake

intro_text: The project ends in a whimper, just a meeting with your manager. There was never going to be any cake. You resignedly flicked you professional profile to "available for work".
pbn: to reflect on your time at TechCo
